subject:
Re: [cc-community] Do you know about case study on why it is better
	to use CC instead of full Copyright?
body:
"attila kelényi" :
> Then I guess we've been all mislead about the meaning of CC :)> Of course the work is protected by copyright in both cases, but the> point is that some uses are explicitly allowed with CC-d works. And> that's a significant difference. (Dessi obviously meant putting CC> instead of C on the work.)
Obviously there's a difference from the traditional "all rightsreserved" distribution, but then say that, rather than implying thatthe Creative Commons licenses aren't ("full") copyright licenses. Thatjust helps create more confusion about copyright law than therealready is.
-- Björn Lindström Student of computational linguistics, Uppsala University, Sweden
